title: Deontay Wilder predicts Tyson Fury will pull out of rematch
text:
Wilder thinks Fury will pull out (Picture: Getty)

Deontay Wilder believes Tyson Fury is getting in his ‘excuses’ in already and predicts he will pull out of their hotly-anticipated rematch with an ‘injury’.

Fury has made a foray into wrestling since his last appearance in the boxing ring and is due to take on WWE star Braun Strowman in Saudi Arabia on October 31.

The animosity between the pair ramped up a notch this week when Strowman blind-sided Fury when training ahead of the bout, leaving the lineal heavyweight champion clutching his ankle on the floor.

Wilder is set to face Fury again in February (Picture: Anadolu Agency/Getty Images)

And Wilder is concerned that Fury is using WWE to find a way out of their heavyweight duel, which is expected to take place in February, should Wilder dispose of Luis Ortiz.

‘I’m not surprised he got into WWE,’ Wilder told The Sun.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘We’d been saying this a long time ago that he’s gonna try it, he’s been making excuses about the rematch.

‘Now he’s got into the WWE, he’s gonna get “injured” make up excuses and lo and behold we already hearing about he sprained his ankle.

‘But yeah he’s messing around with those big guys, but I do not want to hear no excuses, none, no excuses.’

Wilder and Fury’s first meeting ended in a controversial draw, with Fury convinced he’d won the bout after miraculously getting up from the canvas in the 12th round.
description: Deontay Wilder believes Tyson Fury is getting in his 'excuses' in already and predicts he will pull out of their hotly-anticipated rematch with an 'injury'.
